tweets.text: Data from @EnvAgency. Raw sewage is discharged into our rivers routinely during dry weather. @_kateashley Illustrates what a good decision it was to abandon Oxford to Cambridge Road building @EnvAgency @RSPBEngland  
 #wetlandsarewonderful

And now we know why government have been so busy over the last couple of days.

In 2019 water companies spent over 3,100,000 hours, on over 400,000 occasions dumping sh*t into our rivers and seas.

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly?

Hi @RachSalv, can you help us? We're a community plagued by noxious gasses coming from a poorly run landfill that is far to close to houses. Easily the most complained about site in the UK and the @EnvAgencyMids failed us for years. Can you help?

@UnderwaterMedia @EmmaHowardBoyd I also wonder how many septic tanks are still discharging directly into watercourses on a daily basis.  

Simply because people haven't bothered to upgrade them in line with 2020 regulations because the @EnvAgency doesn't even know who still has one.

tweets.text:
There is something missing from all the quotes from @DefraGovUK  and the @EnvAgency on sewage discharges today, when it comes to the @RiverChess these recent events are in breach of the water companies temporary permit to discharge untreated sewage.
https://t.co/l2QBu8FSLi

@GuttfieldArc @AliDriverUK @Feargal_Sharkey @rollingpinboy @Thames21 @UnderwaterMedia @EnvAgencySE @thameswater Hi - I checked with colleagues. No pollution was confirmed a while ago Stranded fish in flooded field went through a pump when draining. Operator advised to screen next time.

@annjsmall @StinkStopthe @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA I drove past the site at just after 8 last night and it was horrific. I'm fortunate I live 2 miles away but I get it some days too. I suggest @ClareDinnisEA needs to experience it for herself because I'm amazed the people living nearby have been as patient as they have.

@PJennings88 @EnvAgency @RiverChess But wait, government have a plan.

They're going to give water companies a legal duty to publish the sewage data. Oops they already have a legal duty, from 2015, see Fish Legal v Information Commissioner. (1./2)

Disgraceful pollution incident on the River Roding right now: a @thameswater pipe is spewing 10k‚Äôs litres of raw sewage a day into the Aldersbrook & the Roding. It is due to badly designed & maintained sewage systems & they have no idea how long it‚Äôs been going on for. https://t.co/JyQdqAfSSx

@gis_michelle @WindrushWasp @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Something that happens twelve or fifteen times a year isn't exceptional, it is normal. Something that happens once every twelve or fifteen years is exceptional. We are being gaslit into thinking using our rivers as sewers is normal and legal. It is neither.

@WindrushWasp @Feargal_Sharkey Thanks Ash - various definitions floating around of what 'exceptional rainfall' is - I've heard 12 or 15 times per year mentioned and with climate change we can expect that to rise. @EnvAgency certainly need to revise 40-60 spills p.a. for triggering an investigation
